Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Marketing Strategy to Drive Revenue Growth
headline: Learn the best marketing strategies to drive sales and revenue for your business with this free online course.
description: An entrepreneur or small business owner may not realise that a proper marketing strategy is the main difference between a flourishing startup and a failed one. This course will walk you through marketing tactics, techniques and methods. So if you are running a business or planning to launch one, you will learn to develop a winning go-to-market strategy that will consistently drive sales and increase the revenue of your business.
courseDescription:
Are you in the process of launching your business but don’t feel confident about the success of your venture? Or are you struggling in your business or startup and find yourself unable to understand what is going wrong? Perhaps it’s a lack of a proper business plan or marketing strategy. This course explores all the best marketing tactics, methods and techniques, helping you develop a winning go-to-market strategy to achieve a successful sales and revenue outcome for your business.

This course is not just a course but a master class that contains everything you need to create a complete market-driven business strategy for your business or startup. The tools and techniques will guide you through the entire process of creating a go-to-market strategy that will drive your revenue growth and bring financial stability to your venture. Step by step, the tutorials will teach you about quality, how to align your pricing and selling methods, provide business and marketing strategies, help you build a compelling value proposition, properly define your target market and much more. In addition, video instruction, business planning tools and preparation worksheets will help you develop a suitable marketing strategy for your business.

So regardless of whether you are running your company or looking forward to launching one, understanding how to position your product or service makes you stand out from your competitors, gain attraction and achieve success for your business. This course will teach you how to create a solid plan to beat your rivals and enhance the customer experience through uniqueness. You also get a helpful learning tool as a downloadable resource to aid and maximise the value of your journey through the course. These worksheets will coach you through the process of creating a go-to-market strategy for your business. So register today and take a step ahead of the competition!

Start Course Now

• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to :
    • Define what a unique competitive advantage is and its main attributes.
    • Identify Your unique competitive advantage.
    • Explain how to evaluate and test your unique competitive advantage.
    • Describe common mistakes that happen when coming up with a unique competitive advantage.
    • Explain what effective product and service positioning is and its importance.
    • Describe how to position your product or service to potential customers.
    • Identify in detail key attributes required for a successful product and service positioning strategy.
    • Describe how to craft a solid positioning statement for your business and the mistakes to avoid.

  • Positioning is about Your Customer's Point of View

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

    • A unique competitive advantage helps drives overall business strategy and gives the customer a reason to buy from you. It is also important from an investor's point of view.
    • Evaluating the competitive landscape, testing your unique competitive advantage, and evaluating your strengths are some of the steps which help determine your competitive advantage.
    • Stating your business is the best, being everything to everyone, making price a unique competitive advantage are some of the biggest mistakes entrepreneurs make when Crafting competitive advantage.
    • Creating a positioning strategy is all about how you want the world (your customers) to see your products or service. It is the intersection between business strategy & customer needs.
    • Product Quality, Uniqueness, Uniqueness, Price, Sustainability, Level of Service, and Convenience, are some of thestandard attributes of an effective positioning strategy.
    • A positioning strategy should always come from the Customer's point of view and should be based on reality, clear and definitive with around 5 -7 core attributes.
    • Business capability, Customer relevance, and the market are three main criteria oneshould look at when evaluating positioning attributes.
    • Confusing positioning strategy with competitive analysis, making competitive comparisons, using a tagline as positioning, and overly aspirational positioning are some of the common mistakes that must be avoided when developing a positioning strategy.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Describe the importance of a target market for your business.
    • Recognize commonly-used demographic and psychographic attributes for defining a target market.
    • Describe the complete process for defining as well as validating standard and custom attributes.
    • Identify, clarify and refine the target market for your product or service.
    • Explain what unique value propositions are and their main characteristics.
    • Describe the complete process of developing the unique value proposition of your business.
    • Explain how to identify the emotional and practical benefits your business offers.
    • Describe how to create, determine and prioritize the uniqueness of your business and present a compelling story to impress the customers.

  • Characteristics of Unique Value Propositions

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

    • The target market is the foundation of an overall go-to-market strategy.
    • Determining your target market should start with zeroing on who is ideal for your products or services.
    • Geography, Sexual Orientation, Education, occupation are some of the main demographic attributes.
    • Values, desires, goals, interests, attitude, and lifestyle choices are some of the main Psychographics characteristics.
    • Broad Target market, Selected Target market unable to afford your product or service, Target market being too narrow, and ignoring important psychographics are some common mistakes to be avoided when determining the target market.
    • A unique value proposition (UVP) is a statement about the emotional and practical benefits your product or offer to the customer and informs why you are different. A unique value proposition must come from the Customer perspective. From an investor's perspective, your unique value proposition must be unique and compelling.
    • The difference between a unique competitive advantage and a unique value proposition is while a unique competitive advantage focuses on the market, a unique value proposition focuses on the customer.
    • A need-basedvalue proposition creates more impact on a customer than those based on desire or want.
    • Not focusing 100% on the customer is a common mistake entrepreneur makes when creating their value proposition.
